titleInfo.title: al-Ḥāwī fī al-ṭibb الحاوي في الطب Rāzī, Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Zakarīyā رازي، أبو بكر محمد بن زكريا

physicalDescription.extent: Material: Eastern laid paperDimensions: 215 x 150 mm leaf [170 x 110 mm written]Foliation: British Museum foliation in pencil; quire marks partially visible on some folia (see e.g. ff. 67r and 68r)Ruling: Misṭarah; ff. 3v-274v: 21 lines per page; vertical spacing 13 lines per 10 cm; ff. 275v-415v: 17 lines per page; vertical spacing 10 lines per 10 cmScript: Naskh; more than one hand, changes of scribal hand noticeable at ff. 72r, 101r, 163r, 221r, and 275rInk: Black ink, with rubricated headings and overlinings in redDecoration: NoneBinding: British Museum maroon half-leather binding, both covers gilt tooled with coat of arms and legend 'Bibliotheca Arundeliana'; indications that previous bindings had envelope flaps (ff. 1, 2, and 275)Condition: Minor insect damage, some repaired; some bleed-through of iron-gall inkMarginalia: Few by more than one handSeals: None

mods.abstract: Parts (أجزاء) eight, nine, and ten of the Kitāb al-Ḥāwī(كتاب الحاوي, Liber continens), an encyclopaedic medical compendium by Abū Bakr Muḥammad ibn Zakarīyā al-Rāzī (أبو بكر محمد بن زكريا الرأزي; d. ca 925).The volume comprises two separate codicological units (manuscripts):Parts Eight and Nine (الجزء الثامن والجزء التاسع, ff. 1r-274v);Part Ten (الجزء العاشر, ff. 275r-415v).
